Students will gain a foundational understanding of Data Science, tracing its evolution and significance across diverse sectors such as business, healthcare, insurance, and finance. The curriculum addresses essential topics, encompassing Big Data Analytics, Data Engineering, Business Analytics, Machine Learning Design Patterns, and the nuances between Supervised & Unsupervised Learning. Enhancing the course content, students will explore foundational concepts like deep neural networks, model architecture design, functional programming, and ML Interpretability, which aim to demystify the black-box nature of many ML models. A central component of our curriculum is the transformative potential of large language models, such as the GPT-series, Gemini, and Claude. Students will appreciate how these models are pivotal in data analytics, especially in their capacity to generate R and Python code for streamlined and automated data processing.Throughout the course, the emphasis on practical applications ensures that students garner hands-on experience with the R and Python programming languages, addressing modern data analytics challenges. This course is tailored for those eager to both grasp and apply the principles of data science and ML/AI in concrete real-world contexts.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】本課程為一學分之課程，主要以講授與學生演練方式進行，並搭配來自不同產業及學術背景的業界講者分享創業經驗與職涯規劃的演講，加深修課學生對生涯規劃與發展的思考與準備。課程安排為每周兩小時授課時間，連續進行九週，共十八小時。課程包括以下三個目標，首先讓修課學生進行自我探索，了解其人格特質及個人職業適性後，對應選修科系的專業職能，評估生涯發展。課程的第二部分著重讓修課學生增強個人職涯發展的知識與技能，包括職前的自我評估、求職的專業形象、撰寫專業並個人化的履歷表、面試時的口語與文字表達、職場所需的團隊合作溝通、跨文化及國際化素養等，將職涯準備實際運用於未來的實習與就業上。課程第三大部分，將學習目標著重在結合前兩部分的職涯探索與準備後，進一步透過業界專業人士到課演講，以講者多年的業界經驗、職場實務與時事案例，提供自我探索與職涯準備的方向和建議本課程邀請的三位業界講師分別為阿默蛋糕周守訓董事長、智慧行動公司創辦人暨人權律師童文薰以及澎湖Bunny Café創辦人林育賢，將分享他們創業、跨業經營、生涯發展及職涯規劃的點滴。三位講者其學術養成來自不同領域，共同點卻都有跨領域發展與創業的職涯發展。藉由業界講者的實務經營及創業過程的分享，期能透過課程互動與討論，讓修課學生對職涯發展有更多元、開放的想法與擘劃。另外，本課程也與溫世仁文教基金會合作，以職場即戰力為主軸，透過職場專業展現、提升職場良好形象，以及職場表達與說話技巧等主題，穿插在本課程授課內容以及自主學習的教材中。修課學生也將透過撰寫履歷與自傳、自我表達、模擬面試等實作，做好職涯準備。 This course is taught and practiced by students, and is matched with industry speakers to share entrepreneurial experience and career planning. The course includes the following three goals. First, let the students in the course conduct self-exploration, understand their personality traits and personal professional suitability, and then use the analysis results to increase professional functions. The second course goal is to combine workplace practices and current affairs cases. (SMBT), and (3) Mr. Kelvin Lin, Chairman of Bunny Cafe to share their entrepreneurial, business, life, career planning and development. 課程目標: 本課程的首要目標是【1】幫助非資訊領域的同學跨越程式語言的進入障礙，我們認為學習程式語言的重點在於實作，所以簡單介紹完R語言之後，我們會 【2】在R語言的環境下幫同學複習基本的機率與統計分析方法，然後我們會使用實際的資料案例，讓同學們 【3】學習如何使用程式語言和機率統計來幫助我們處理重要的商業實務，如：市場區隔、品牌定位、價量關係、定價策略、產品設計、市場競爭等等。在我們正式介紹大數據相關的技術之前，我們計畫透過這一系列的資料案例讓同學們親身【4】體驗程式語言、機率統計和商管知識這三者之間的強大綜效。There're three major course objectives :1. Introduce R Language. Overcome the entry barrier of programming language with interactive notebooks, web-pages and web-based simulation tools.2. Prepare the students for advanced analytics courses that involve big-data, ma-chine learning and/or artificial intelligence, e.g., the summer class offered by the college of management.3. Develop major business analytics skills, including market segmentation, brand positioning, customer value management, revenue management, new product development, product design, product line planning, price discrimination, and competitive/dynamic pricing.4. To experience the synergy among programming language, statistics and managerial knowledge.

授課方式: 考慮到在學程剛開始的時候，可能部分的同學還不會寫程式或沒有受過足夠的機率統計訓練，所以，課程一開始我們會先協助同學根據我們預先編制的R語言與基礎統計自學地圖，以互(自)助學習的方式先上完在DataCamp上面的一系列課程並取得線上認證，之後我們將仿造哈佛大學(Data Science, Harvard 2018)的作法，使用R語言帶同學複習基本的機率統計，然後我們會分別從ESSEC和Accenture(Strategic Business Analytics Specialization)以及哥倫比亞大學(Business Analytics)這兩個學校的線上課程裡面挑出一些比較基本的案例，讓同學做商業數據分析的實務練習。做一個入門的課程，本課程最主要的學習目標是先要幫助同學們克服程式語言的進入障礙，對非資訊背景的同學而言，我們認為像DataCamp這樣「手把手教你寫程式」的自助學習是最容易上手的學習方式，依據我們暑期課程的經驗，對完全沒有寫過程式的同學來說，定期在每一周安排助教時間，讓同學一起過來互相一起討論功課，也是非常有效的方法。The Time Allocation would be : Lecture 48 Hours + Project Presentation 8 HoursConsidering that some students do not have programming experience. The aim is to cultivate promising elite students from non-information-related departments, equipping them with the ability to address domain-specific issues using core information software technologies.課程初期會先傳遞設計思考理念，培養學生以人為本的觀點，透過使用者的角度去體驗，以達到真正最符合使用者的設計，從而運用設計思考於解決商業與科技相關問題，課程中後階段將帶學生進入UI/UX和Python的實務操作，包含基礎的程式設計到商業上的各種應用，此外，在教學過程中也會加入軟體工程實務。In the initial phase of the course, the design thinking concept will be introduced, fostering a human-centered perspective among students. This includes foundational programming skills as well as various business applications. Additionally, the instructional process will incorporate software engineering practices.
課程目標: 本課程訓練學生了解商業場域需求並具備程式能力來實作方案，將介紹如何透過設計思考來找出需求並提出解決方案，並教授使用者介面設計（UI）以落實方案的親和性，最後教授Python程式設計來落實方案的邏輯和程序。This course aims to train students in understanding business domain requirements and equipping them with programming capabilities to implement solutions. It will introduce how to use design thinking to identify needs and propose solutions. The course will cover user interface design (UI) to enhance the user-friendliness of solutions. Finally, it will teach Python programming to implement the logic and processes of the solutions.

The goal of this course is to focus on Data Science, to develop a full range of financial management talents through R language programming skills, and to analyze appropriate personal financial trading strategies from a huge amount of quantitative financial information.
課程目標: 因應未來FinTech趨勢，本課程的教學目標就是從資料科學(Data Science)角度出發，透過R語言程式教學，培養學生運用R程式能力，從量化財務信息分析出合適的個人理財交易策略，達到全方位理財能力。本課程前半段將專注在R語言教學，後半段專注在運用R語言分析相關交易策略之可行性。Cultivate the students have the ability of data science. Teach students R language and programing. Focus on R programing at the beginning, and use R to create trading strategy after that. Finally, cultivate students to be FinTech talents.

課程目標: 增進學生就業機會及競爭力，培養學生對永續金融和有關變革趨勢的認識，以利他們進入金融、保險或其他企業任職，並在永續發展的議題上發揮更大影響力。This course is aim to enhance students’ competitiveness and employment opportunity. Not surprisingly, a large number of firms have developed their businesses into foreign markets and become multinational corporations in order to build strong competitive advantage. Third, important cases and issues relating to international businesses are discussed.

Should there be Multilateral Rules on Foreign Direct Investment?自2019年美中貿易戰爭爆發，接著新的國際競爭又以科技為核心，而企業在新的科技創新和競爭下，面臨不斷的挑戰，經營的戰略與手法不斷更新。今日，每一個「決策管理」過程，企業管理者都面對了市場與法律的糾結；尤其在行銷與通路、人力資源，甚至是策略管理的實務上！但是，另一方面，市場的風險也大量提高，而「商業間諜」與「黑心企業」永遠存在嗎？暗黑勢力永遠蠢動在資本與國家的結合過程嗎？例如，企業勝出先以營業秘密得失做表現嗎？法律真能保護消費者與勞工嗎？* 本學期此一課程以「營業秘密法」和「消費者保護法」兩套法律與實例與趨勢為主題，而內容主要含括5項問題的討論：問題1：法律 vs. 市場～市場與法律的關係為何？是干涉？還是助長呢？經濟(或者市場)是一個獨立運作的系統，或是有其他條件確保其存在，例如政策與法律？問題2：當代的市場樣貌？～在討論經濟相關議題時，常聽到凱恩斯主義、新自由主義這些名詞，這些概念內容為何？如何落實為具體的經濟活動呢？依循這些原則下的經濟就是好的經濟嗎？我們何妨以營業秘密法和消費者保護法兩項，進行檢驗和討論？問題3：（利害關係的管理？）國家、市場、企業與消費者，哪種關係？～如果說，一個管理者在「決策選擇」的關頭，面對國家、市場、企業與消費大眾四者互相影響，那麼這些影響的因素與機制為何？問題4：國際市場？管理的組織及其角色？～關於商務決策管理，「國家、市場、(其他)企業與消費大眾」四者的關係與互動，各種國際市場中，管理組織的作用有哪些呢？問題5：如何評價當代市場發展？～經過前面四項主題的討論後，企業管理者都面對了市場與法律的糾結，我們如何評價今日的市場商品化之發展？其次，關於法律與市場的脈絡分析，本學期課程的主軸以「營業秘密法」和「消費者保護法」兩套法律與實例為主題，而歷史發展的命題依序為：第1部分：總論～經濟需要市場嗎？需要法律嗎？第2部分：台灣對照歐美：經濟的法律環境與秩序第3部分：西方法律系統對現代經濟與社會的影響歡迎喜歡討論「企業管理者如何面對市場與法律的糾結？」命題的同學們，一起加入。

Regulatory metrics and guidelines.醫療監管科學是近期越發重要而有趣的學門。基本上，監管科學中存在差距，因此需要解決這些差距，以改善藥物開發和評估，最終使其獲得滿足患者需求的創新藥物成為可能。因此，不同於過往以看守和監控為主，至少3個正向的新導向值得我們研究：(1)激勵藥物開發研究人員和資助組織，(2)提供新的主題和相關研究的參考資料，(3)加速藥物開發的創新並轉化為有效、高品質的療法。針對當前美國、中國、歐盟和日本的藥品監管機構，因正式啟動了監管科學計劃，而做為課程的目標研究對象，對這些國家與地區的政府文件、數據彙編和相關文獻進行分析和審查。本學期（113-1）課程，運用課堂討論的16件個案研究，從醫護人員欠缺、勞資爭議、用藥的短缺、醫療產業關於創新科技…，到企業併購或策略聯盟的實例，現況與爭議，主要內容包括：1.	科學的形成與沿革：關於醫療監管科學的定義尚無共識，但發展和應用監管科學的願景卻是相同的，即開發新的工具、標準和指南，以提高評估受管制產品的風險和收益的有效性和效率。2.	藥品監管機構：每個藥品監管機構都確定了各自監管科學發展的優先領域和特定目標，這些目標是基於技術（例如毒理學、臨床評估）、過程（例如與醫療保健系統的伙伴關係）或產品（例如藥物設備組合產品）的目標集合。3.	政策與法制的配合：持續支持和定期審查監管科學的發展，對於藥品監管機構更加有效地應對法規方面，建置健全體制的科學性挑戰至關重要。4.	人才培育：增強工作人員能力，提高監管效率和透明度，以及改善跨境溝通能力被認為是監管科學發展的主要成果。5.	創新模式擴大科學合作：為了推進醫療監管科學，藥品監管機構已為員工培訓、研究項目資金、信息技術建設和實驗室基礎設施提供了大量資源，同時通過多種創新模式擴大科學合作。6.	監管衡量與準則：衡量監管科學的產出包括科學出版物、受資助項目、監管機構交互、評估方法和監管準則。

This course addresses a selected set of topics focusing on understanding human and organizational processes that facilitate or hinder work performance. The emphasis is on human behavior in relation to management practices with special emphasis on teamwork.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】This course provides an overview of the essential practices for managing human resources. Throughout the semester, students will learn how to make theoretically and empirically sound decisions on how to design a job, how to attract talent, whom to hire, what to pay, how to train and develop employees, and how to evaluate performance. These practices are important because they affect employees’ motivation and ability to provide products and services that customers value, which in turn impacts an organization’s performance. Through the years, human resource management (HRM) has evolved from an administrative function (focusing on filling out forms and processing paperwork) into a more active role in supporting the organization’s strategy. Therefore, we will also discuss how effective HR strategies can be crafted to help organizations gain sustainable competitive advantages.
課程目標: Goal #1: Increase content knowledge relevant to the field of HRM Goal #2: Learn to apply HRM theories and research to “real” world context Goal #3: Gain hands-on experience in HR consulting— apply theories and practices to an HR issue faced by an organization and provide professional recommendations for addressing the issues
授課方式: The method of study for this course will include a combination of textbook, lecture, class discussion, and hand-on experience to help students learn knowledge related to human resource management and strengthen students’ ability to apply knowledge and theories.

This course will help you develop an understanding of business ethics and current debates in this field. The course will explore what ethical and unethical business practice consists of by providing clear explanations of a number of ethics theories, demonstrating how they can be used to analyze the ethicality of business activity. This course will help students develop views and opinions of what ‘ethical decision making’ is, and how logical and reasonable decisions can be made and justified. Students will be encouraged to think independently, challenge established theory, reflect on the subjects discussed, and develop views and perspectives on ethical business and management. The course will integrate documentaries, films, debates and news items (where possible) to help students think about real-life ethical dilemmas. Sustainable Leadership Forum (GHRM511): On six days this course will follow a seminar style with invited speakers. The aim is to prepare students to be future leaders who are not only proficient in managing the complexities of international business but also committed to leading with a vision that ensures the well-being of future generations. Through engaging in discussions on real-world cases and interactions with industry leaders, students will learn about strategic decision-making, fostering resilient and adaptable organizations.
課程目標: 1. Understand, explain and analyse academic theory and evidence relating to ethics and the application of ethics in business decision making.2. Demonstrate analytical capabilities and critical understanding of ethical theories, their application to the workplace, and topical business issues.3. Develop awareness and understanding of how other people may think about ethical issues.4. Develop communication skills, including the ability to articulate well-reasoned, logical views clearly.5. Enhance employability, critical thinking, global awareness and teamwork skills.6. Develop research skills and the ability to analyse and interpret information.
授課方式: Lecture, Class debate, Workshop, Reading/Writing assignments, Group presentation, ReportAttendance is recorded from Week 1

課程大綱: 課程分為三個部分：病毒學培養與診斷、病毒分子生物學、發病機制和控制。 在第一部分，我們將描述病毒學的基礎知識和研究病毒的方法。 第二部分描述了病毒的繁殖，從基因複制、基因轉錄、翻譯和病毒顆粒釋放。 第三部分介紹了免疫系統和病毒進化的策略以及感染的治療和控制。
課程目標: 病毒是目前重要的新興感染症的病原體，除了嚴重影響人類的健康，尤其水產養殖也因病毒感染造成經濟上重大的損失。因此瞭解病毒的分子生物學是預防及治療病毒染重要的知識。本課程藉由瞭解病毒生活史、病毒感染與疾病關係、病毒與免疫的關係、病毒基因演化與流行的關係及病毒致病的分子機制，進而啟發對開發抗病毒策略的研究。
授課方式: 教師授課及學生專題書報討論。

系所: 海洋環境及工程學系碩士班
課程大綱: This is an introductory course on ocean modelling. Governing equations describing dynamic processes in the ocean are presented, and approximations to simpler forms are discussed. Numerical schemes are introduced using prototypical equations that are representative of marine transport processes and shallow water phenomena. Special emphasis is put on the convergence and stability properties. The course contains laboratory practice where students will implement and solve basic hydrodynamic models. Applications include:- Diffusion and advection of tracers- Storm surges- Tsunami - Tidal flooding
課程目標: The students will have a first-hand experience with the computational simulation of marine systems. Basic principles and limitations of numerical approximation schemes will be understood.

系所: 海洋環境及工程學系碩士班
課程大綱: The course surveys the application of hydrodynamic principles and approximations to pipelines, open channels, coastlines, etc. Fundamentals of incompressible fluid dynamics are reviewed. Physical reasonings and insights behind the engineering designs are discussed, and the underlying practical assumptions in the modelling process are elaborated. Topics include:- Basics of fluid flow (Bernoulli principle, Reynolds Transport Theorem, viscous effects and turbulence, boundary layers)- Parameterization of hydrodynamic losses- Flows in closed conduits and pipes- Pipe networks- Hydraulic machinery- Open channel flow- Hydraulic structures- Introduction to coastal hydraulics
課程目標: The students will develop basic understanding of underlying hydraulic concepts used in water resources, coastal and offshore engineering, and practice the design of some basic flow systems.

系所: 海洋環境及工程學系碩士班
課程大綱: Offshore structures have been affected by different environmental external forces for a long time. Engineers usually use structural matrix analysis to understand the internal forces and deformations of offshore structures under the influence of environmental external forces. This course will introduce the matrix displacement method, which takes the node displacement as the basic unknown quantity, and then organizes and arranges the stiffness of its basic structure (truss structure, beam structure and rigid frame structure) and offshore structure in the form of matrix. , to obtain the node displacement and the internal force and deformation of the structure in the presence of external forces.
課程目標: 1. Establish the concept of structural matrix2. Structural matrix analysis truss structure3. Structural Matrix Analysis Beam Structure4. Structural matrix analysis of rigid frame structures5. Structural matrix analysis of offshore structures

課程目標: 本課程之教學目標在於教導學生對三大廢水處理方法中，有關生物處理的部分，能透徹了解其去除污染物之原理，以及工程設計所需考量之原則及方法，以利於未來在實際從事設計或操作廢水生物處理廠時，能加以運用並解決問題。

系所: 海洋事務研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 國際漁業法律體制自二次大戰後迄今，已有長足之演進。本課程係針對國際間涉及漁業之文件（包括具法律約束力之硬法及不具法律約束力之軟法）進行介紹，並瞭解其間之變化。前者包括1958年日內瓦公海生物資源漁捕與養護公約、1982年聯合國海洋法公約、1993聯合國糧農組織（FAO）公海遵守協定、1995年聯合國魚群協定及2009年FAO港口國措施等；後者包括1992年21世紀議程第17章、1995年FAO責任漁業行為規約及其四個國際行動計畫等文件。 The international fisheries legal regime has evolved considerably since the Second World War. This course introduces basic elements of the international fisheries legal regime, including both legally binding hard law and non-legally binding soft law, and examines the evolution and changes that have taken place. The former includes the 1958 Convention on Fishing and Conservation of the Living Resources of the High Seas, the 1982 United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea, the 1993 FAO Agreement to Promote Compliance with International Conservation and Management Measures by Fishing Vessels on the High Seas, the 1995 United Nations Fish Stocks Agreement, and the 2009 FAO Port State Measures Agreement, etc. The latter includes the Chapter 17 of the Agenda 21, the 1995 FAO Code of Conduct for Responsible Fisheries and its four International Plans of Action (IPOAs).
課程目標: 本課程之主旨在於使學生瞭解國際漁業法之演進與重要規範，包括全球性國際漁業法律文件及區域漁業管理組織之設立公約與其所通過之建決議案等。This course is designed to provide students with an understanding of the evolution and important regulations of the international fisheries legal regime, including global international fisheries legal instruments, constitutional conventions and resolutions adopted by regional fisheries management organizations (RFMOs).

課程大綱: 我國管轄權水域（例如內水、領海、鄰接區、專屬經濟海域或大陸礁層上）存有起源於我國、他國或起源國不明之水下文化遺產（underwater cultural heritage, UCH），乃至他國管轄權水域或「區域」（the Area）亦可能存有起源於我國之水下文化遺產。因此，我國有妥善治理水下文化治理的重要實際利益，並需要反映於國內的法令、政策及行政措施。例如，與他國合作進行水下考古（underwater archaeologic operation）、打擊盜掘、文物走私等新興海上犯罪，或追討返還流失海外水下文化遺產等新興議題，係屬海洋文化外交（maritime cultural diplomacy）的操作，即有賴國內法律的授權與支持，乃至於相關國際法政文件的綜合運用。 水下文化遺產的治理，是「海洋」與「文化」兩大領域的交錯議題。水下文化遺產多位處海域環境，因此會受到海洋環境的高度影響（例如海流沖刷、氣候變遷、海平面上升等）。對於水下文化遺產的研究，有助於進一步掌握氣候變遷、海平面上升的變化，進而強化對海洋環境的永續照管（stewardship）。因此，聯合國教科文組織（UNESCO）指出「海洋的過去即為我們的未來」（The Ocean’s past is our future）。此外，水下文化遺產同時也可能影響周邊海洋環境。例如，成為海洋生物的庇護場所，或因持續漏油而污染周邊海洋生態。因此，水下文化遺產的治理，需要海洋科學研究（marine scientific research, MSR）的投入，例如水下科學儀器或技術的運用、深海考古的發展。 由此可見，對於水下文化遺產的治理，早已非單純「文化」議題，更可能對國家的安全及永續有所貢獻，例如文化安全（cultural security）。 當然，水下文化遺產的治理，在本質上仍不離文化此一特性。多數社會大眾所認知的水下文化遺產，主要是「有形文化遺產」（tangible cultural heritage），例如沉船（shipwreck）、遺址（site）、人類遺骸（human remains）或貨物（cargo）等。若從「海洋文化地景」（maritime cultural landscape, MCL）角度以觀，水下文化遺產僅為其中「位於水下」（under water）的部分，其他還包括陸域環境中人類與海洋互動關係（例如岸際的地名與港口的形成、造船工藝的發展等）、人類在海洋水表上與海洋間的互動關係（例如航海技術、海上交通貿易習慣等）。這些則多屬於「無形文化遺產」（intangible cultural heritage）。 再者，臺灣也具有相當的海洋文化多樣性（cultural diversity），而反映於包括水下文化遺產在內等標的中。例如，歷史上受到西班牙、葡萄牙、荷蘭、日本乃至中國大陸等各方的殖民或統治，因而與東亞乃至全球海洋貿易、歷史、文化產生連結，或者與南島語系文化間的聯繫，此觀目前已發現或研究所悉沉船，已可見到部分線索。 根據前述背景，水下文化遺產的治理，是高度跨領域的議題。我國為回應前述國際與國內的治理需求，已於2015年制定公布施行「水下文化資產保存法」，隔年發布相關子法，與其他相關法令共同「由內而外」、「一層一層」構成我國水下文化遺產治理的整體法政架構。例如，文化資產保存法、中華民國領海及鄰接區法、海洋基本法、海洋保育法等，乃至於未來可能推動制（訂）定的海洋空間規劃法令。 本課程作為我國大學中最早針對水下文化遺產所開設一系列完整專業課程之一，且為該系列課程的第三堂，將賡續第二堂有關聯合國教科文組織水下文化遺產保護公約（Convention on the Protection of the Underwater Cultural Heritage）之講授基礎，進一步本於授課教師過去多年來參與我國水下文化遺產保存法令研究、行政院版本草案起草及諮詢等權威實務經驗，帶領同學重返並見證我國推動制（訂）定水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理相關法令的歷史現場，精確掌握該等核心法令之發展、解釋及適用相關能力，乃至向外觸及其他間接有關的法令，以作為未來參與水下文化遺產治理，乃至於其他所涉海洋事務相關議題所需專業法政基礎。 本課程的進行，一貫包括但不限於「法條的解釋」。因此，修課學生亦不限於法政領域背景。為反映水下文化遺產的跨領域特性，本課程一貫高度歡迎包括海洋事務研究所在內多元領域學生選修，亦即包括自然科學、人文及社會科學所有領域。唯有多元專業的投入，才能有效治理、保護我國的水下文化遺產，甚至參與或推動國際合作。
課程目標: 一、水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理之重要原則與實踐二、我國水下文化遺產保存、保護與管理相關法令之發展、解釋與適用

課程大綱: 根據聯合國文獻檢討「永續發展」的歷史演變階段，並檢視台灣目前的永續發展與淨零減碳現況。課程第一部分閱讀1987年的「我們共同的未來」，分析此份聯合國文件的代表性意義；第二部分閱讀1992年的「廿一世紀議程」，這份文件對永續發展的解決方案呈現與「我們共同的未來」不同的取向，反映當時主流的國際政治經濟制度；第三部分討論CSR、ESG、SDGs為何出現的歷史變化，並精讀《翻轉世界：2030年永續發展議程》此一聯合國文獻；第四部分討論臺灣 2050 淨零排放路徑及策略，以及淨零減碳作為永續發展案例。
課程目標: 本課程將仔細分析「永續發展（sustainable development）」的三面向：經濟、社會與環境，包括其歷史演變，以及這些概念所鑲嵌的全球政治經濟基礎。據此評估2015年聯合國永續發展目標其適切性。最後以淨零減碳做為案例來檢驗國際與國內的永續發展所涉及到的各種制度與實踐上的問題。

課程大綱: This course provides a comprehensive yet easily accessible introduction to this captivating field. Its content spans the four core disciplines of oceanography, examining in turn the geological and geophysical setting of the ocean floor, the chemical properties of seawater and sediments, the circulation and hydrodynamic properties of ocean basins, the biology and ecology of marine systems, and concluding with an assessment of human impacts on the ocean. Linkages between these areas will be emphasized at every opportunity, thus revealing the multidisciplinary nature of oceanography. It is hoped that this approach will give future marine engineers and developers the basic tools to make sound decisions in the management of the marine environment while helping prospective researchers to select their specific research area.
課程目標: •	To understand oceanographic concepts such as global plate tectonics, steady state, residence time, biogeochemical cycles, progressive waves, biological habitats, food chains, ecosystem functioning and coastal dynamics.•	To integrate the above physical, chemical, and biological information to examine the intricacies of dynamic coastal environments, using examples drawn from various parts of Taiwan's coastline.•	To understand the nature and scale of contemporary environmental issues such as climate change, ocean acidification and marine plastic pollution.
授課方式: The course will be delivered through a combination of active learning strategies. These will include:PowerPoint lectures and short videos.Class discussions of assigned readings.

課程大綱: The contents of physiology of marine organisms will cover three levels: body, organs and cells. Physiological functions discussed in this semester will begin with a general introduction, and following with include cellular signaling and endocrine regulation, nerve function, muscle and movement, circulation system, respiration system, ion/water balance, digestion and energy metabolism, and thermal physiology. 海洋生物生理學將涵蓋個體，器官與細胞3個層級來說明，本學期將先簡介生理學的基本內容，然後分別討論以下主題，(1) 訊息傳遞(包括細胞訊息傳遞，內分泌系統，神經傳導)；(2) 運動生理(包括細胞層級移動與肌肉運動)；(3)循環系統；(4)呼吸系統；(5)離子與水的平衡；(6) 消化與能量代謝；(7)熱生理學。
課程目標: 1. To know how marine lives perform their biological functions in marine ecosystem: This course will provide students with basic knowledge to know how marine organisms survive in this planet, which will be an important foundation to explore the complicate marine ecosystem and interactions between organisms, or between organisms and environment.2. To intensify the awareness of the importance of marine life protection. The more our students know how marine organisms evolve to adapt to the environment of this planet by developing amazing physiological functions, the more our students will respect the meaning of life and willing to protect our home of living.1. 了解海洋生物如何適應環境的生理功能相關知識: 這方面的知識是深入探討海洋生物物種間或生物與環境互動關係的重要基礎知識。2. 加強對海洋生物保育的認知: 透過了解海洋生物為了適應各種環境選態壓力所演化出的精妙生理機制，讓學生更尊重生命並願意關心與投入海洋的研究與生態保育的工作。

課程大綱: 本課程旨在探討驅動並影響地球氣候系統短期及長期變化的動力機制，包含討論大氣圈與水圈、岩石圈及生物圈的交互作用。此外，課程中也會介紹氣候與海洋系統短週期的震盪反應對環境的影響，及人類活動對氣候及環境的衝擊效應，以及目前新的研究成果與發現。

授課方式: 課堂講課與電腦程式實際操作

課程大綱: This course aims to equip the students with the English language and communication skills that scientists and technologists need to communicate with fellow scientists and technologists as well as with non-scientists. The first few lectures will cover the main steps in building up basic but logical discourses in Scientific English. This will include acquiring some basic building blocks such as vocabulary, syntax and tenses, and how to use them. These building blocks will then be used to describe the elements of a graph such as trends, changes, rate of change, variations, correlations etc.The second phase of the course (after the mid-term exam) will consist of research paper discussions. Informal feedback will be given to the students after each paper discussion so that they may improve their reading strategy and become better able to distil the information contained in a scientific paper. Students will choose their paper topics among a list provided by the Course Instructor.In the third and last phase of the course, the students will be asked to produce a poster from reading materials provided by the Course Instructor and to present their poster in front of their peers. General guidelines for preparing and presenting the poster will be provided in advance during a special class session.
課程目標: 1.	To expand the students' vocabulary and language skills that they need to share scientific information in their respective fields.2.	To guide the students through the process of dissecting and analysing a scientific paper.3.	To give the student the opportunity to practice their newly acquired language skills through class discussions and workshops.
評分方式: 1.Participation and paper discussions：25%2.Mid-term exam：25%3.Mini assignments：15%4.Poster：20%5.Poster presentation：15%
授課方式: This course will be delivered through a combination of active learning strategies which will include:1. PowerPoint lectures2. Collaborative learning in small groups working in an interdisciplinary context.3. Group discussions4. Whole-class feedback on what went well and what could have been improved, given after class discussions and poster presentations | Individual, written feedback on each written assignment.

課程大綱: 珊瑚礁是海洋中最炫目、歧異度最高、生物種類最多且最複雜的生態系統，孕育數十萬種已知和超過數百萬種未 知的海洋生物，超過數十億人口的生計與珊瑚礁生態穩定有關，但海水暖化正以頻繁且日益嚴重的珊瑚白化現象 威脅珊瑚礁生態，因此本課程將從珊瑚礁的生化、生理與生態說明珊瑚礁的功能性與全球氣候變遷影響的各個層 面，並提及珊瑚礁生態保育與管理。主要內容包括:1.熱帶海洋生態系中珊瑚礁的獨特多樣性與生產力。2.造礁生物與棲地競爭。3.棲地型態。4.共生互動模式。5.珊瑚礁生態中的微生物、單胞藻與其他浮游生物的角色。6.珊瑚礁魚類。7.遊憩、漁業和養殖的影響。8.環境壓力種類及對珊瑚礁的影響。9.珊瑚礁保育與管理的策略。
課程目標: 1. 了解珊瑚礁的生態角色與特性2. 提升對海洋生態保育的認知
評分方式: 1.課堂參與：40%2.口頭報告：30%3.答辯與討論：30%

課程大綱: 1. To introduce the biology and ecology of marine primary producers, as well as their roles in oceanography.2. To compare the methods to measure primary productivity and new productivity, and their roles in marine ecosystems.3. To analyze the dynamics and controls of primary productivity in the seas off Taiwan.4. To discuss the current research topics focused on primary productivity and primary producers in the world.
課程目標: To understand the knowledge about marine primary producers, primary productivity and new productivity, and their related research in the present. The graduate students can develop their expertise to research topics related to marine primary productivity and new productivity during the training in this course.
授課方式: The professor will teach knowledge of primary productivity in the classroom. He will also teach the methods and techniques for reading academic journal articles and presentations. He will provide feedback for improvement according to students’ presentation. Students must read at least three English academic journal articles for presentation and discussion. This intensive training builds graduate students’ knowledge of primary productivity, improves efficiency on their thesis research, and provide experience in preparing slides and presentations in a short time. Thereby the training would strengthen graduate students’ professional expertise.

課程大綱: 1.介紹軟骨魚類學，鯊魚、魟魚及銀鮫分類。Introduce the Chondrichthyology - classification and taxonomy of sharks, batoids, and chimaeras. 			2.介紹軟骨魚類繁殖特性。Introduce reproductive patterns of the chondrichthyan fishes.			3.介紹軟骨魚類定齡學。Introduce the sclerochronology for chondrichthyan fishes.			4.介紹軟骨魚類牙齒構造及攝食生態、營養位階。Introduce the structure of teeth, feeding ecology and trophic positions of the chondrichthyan fishes.			5.介紹軟骨魚類的利用及資源現況。Introduce the utilization and status of the chondrichthyan fishes.			6.介紹軟骨魚類的管理及保育。Introduce management and conservation of the chondrichthyan fishes.			7.介紹軟骨魚類追蹤在棲地利用及保育上的應用。Introduce chondrichthyan fishes tracking and the applications on the ecological conservation.
課程目標: 軟骨魚類分為鯊魚（Sharks）、魟魚（Batoids）及銀鮫（Chimaeras），多處於各類型海洋生態系中的頂點，扮演調節海洋生態系平衡的角色，其繁殖數少、成熟遲緩、成長緩慢、壽命長等生活史特性，族群資源對環境變遷及漁業開發相對較敏感，也因此，數種軟骨魚類已被多個地區性漁業組織或國際貿易組織列為禁捕，在臺灣亦有數種軟骨魚類禁捕或保育。本課程的目的主要有：1. 認識軟骨魚類；2.瞭解各類軟骨魚類生活史；3.分析軟骨魚類資源現況；4.探討軟骨魚類的管理及保育；5.軟骨魚類棲地利用及追蹤應用。Chondrichthyan fishes are divided into sharks, batoids, and chimaeras. They are often found at the top of various marine ecosystems, playing a role in regulating the balance of marine ecosystems. Their life history characteristics low fecundity, late maturity, slow growth, and long lifespan, make their population resources relatively sensitive to environmental changes and fisheries exploitations. As a result, several chondrichthyan species have been banned by Regional Fisheries Management Organizations or international trade organizations. In Taiwan, there are also several chondrichthyan species that are protected or subject to fishing bans. The main objectives of this course are: 1) To familiarize with chondrichthyan fishes; 2) To understand the life history of different types of chondrichthyan fishes; 3) To analyze the status of chondrichthyan fishes; 4) To discuss the management and conservation of chondrichthyan fishes; and 5) To explore the habitat use and tracking applications of chondrichthyan fishes.

課程目標: 為滿足我國對綠能轉型的需求，台灣離岸風電近年來已快速發展，裝置容量目前已達2GW。而政府對未來離岸風電裝置容量的規劃也極具雄心，預計2030年為13.1GW、而2050年將達40~55GW。可以預期，台灣未來對離岸風電各領域的人才有亟大需求。本課程目標在於增進學生對台灣離岸風電發展各面向的整體認識，以厚植學生相關知能、建立業界關係、提高未來於離岸風電產業成功就業的機會。

課程大綱: This course looks into the politics of Taiwan through various perspectives, from domestic politics, organisation of the government, elections, social movements, cross-strait relations to international politics.
課程目標: 1. To define concepts and understand issues relevant to the politics of Taiwan.2. To think critically about the domestic and international politics of Taiwan.3. To develop skills for academic writing and presentation.4. To develop techniques for conducting independent research.
評分方式: 1.Class Participation：20%2.Reading Summary 1：25%3.Reading Summary 2：25%4.Final Group Presentation + Report：30%
授課方式: -The course is a combination of both lecture and seminar but will be held mainly in seminar discussions.- We will discuss four subjects in this course: (1) History of Taiwan, (2) Government & Politics, (3) Cross-strait Relations, and (4) International Relations. Students must pick three out of these four subjects in our weekly schedule.- Student should form into groups (4~6 members). Each group should accomplish three tasks as follows:(1) Reading summary: Student should write a summary document of assigned readings (in English, no longer than 5 pages) and give a briefing on the subject matter (no more than 20 minutes). The document should contain (a) the gist of the reading, (b) your reflections or critiques of it, (c) comparison between other assigned readings, and (d) relevant questions in regard to the readings. Students should also submit the document (in either Microsoft Word or PDF format) to the instructor on the day before the seminar via email. Student should do one reading summary before the mid-term and another one before the end-term.(2) Final presentation: In the final seminar, students are required to give a group presentation (no more than 25 minutes) either about the book summary (choosing one book from “Further Readings”) or about their research theme on the politics of Taiwan. You can use PowerPoint to present your research. (3) Final report: After the final presentation, each group should hand in a group report about the theme you research. The report should be written in English and no longer than 10 pages (excluding reference). The report should contain (a) your research theme, (b) your research question, (c) your explanation of why the question matters, (d) your exploration of how the question has been answered by the existing literature, if any, (e) your evaluation of whether the literature answers the question properly, and (d) your answer if the literature’s answer is dissatisfactory to you. There is no tolerance of plagiarism. Once plagiarism is found, the report goes straight to zero points. We will negotiate the deadline during the seminar.

課程目標: 每個研究生在開始修業之前，一定都希望能寫出一本傑出的研究論文，論文要傑出，除了能夠問出好的問題，更重要的是能夠透過合適的研究方法來回答所提出的問題，研究方法的思考，也常能夠協助研究者找尋好的研究問題。在時空環境與資源有限的限制之下，即便是古今中外最優秀的學者，也沒有辦法設計並執行完美的研究方法。每位研究者基於其研究問題、技術能力與資源的差異，僅能試圖設計出最符合本身需求的研究方法。本課程的目標即在於培養學生在研究過程中，能保有研究方法意識，並在認識與實作政治學門常見的研究方法後，能夠根據自身條件，在本課程與未來撰寫論文時，能夠設計並執行最適合自己條件的研究方法。
評分方式: 1.課程參與：60%2.期末研究設計報告：40%
授課方式: 本課程將以教師「講授」與學生參與「討論」並重，教師會帶領學生認識政治學門主要的研究方法。每位同學均需要參與課中討論，由0分起算，滿分25分。研究方法五花八門，課程將著重較多同學實際上使用的「實證性」研究方法。每位學生，需在第二部分共七週的課程，任選兩週主題，提出書面研究設計內容。課程中設計者、授課教師與所有同學都必須對每一個設計內容進行討論。學生需要依據期初選定的研究題目，以及期中所繳交的兩篇研究設計報告為基礎，在優化後於期末繳交研究設計之期末報告，並在課堂中分享。本課程任何書面報告，若涉及遲交或抄襲情事，以0分計，沒有任何商量餘地。

課程大綱: 本課程帶領同學領會如何透過操作經驗資料收集和分析的過程來求真。本課程將透過探索即時事件新聞資料庫、帶領同學學到如何使用資料科學的工具（R & RStudio）進行資料分析，讓同學充份理解經驗研究中學會如何精準發問、敢於使用資料分析挑戰權威，以及透過資料探索發展理論與假設的素養。本課程訓練同學以專案的方式實作，學會分析新聞事件和文本分析的基本技能之後，連結到社科院及管理學院的進階資料分析課程如《厚資料與意義探勘》、《大數據與選舉》、《政治與資訊》、《社群資料分析》、《政治文本分析》及《民意與政治行為研究》等。
課程目標: (一)讓政治科學的研究生具備資料科學的素養，包括獨立操作R開啟專案、自發取得網路資料並進行分析的能力。1.首先以https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataverse/icews提供的新聞事件資料庫，探索兩岸關係，帶領專案分析。2.介紹網路上的R自學資源，使用劉正山老師自編的教材、Imai Kosuke的書籍及Princeton等名校提供的免費資源進行資料分析的重製。(二)讓資料科學的問題意識啟發政治科學學生的思考方式，從傳統驗證式的研究中，走向探索式的資料分析，由此發現新的問題、看見新的解釋方式，甚至挑戰既有知識，或是開發理論。1.驗證性的分析仍為當前實證主義及經驗研究的主流，不可放棄，但會以更有效率的方式，帶領同學在學期前半就能學會用R進行卡方檢定、迴歸分析等學門常用的分析方法。2.探索性的分析需要更多的對資料的熟悉，以及更多工具上的訓練，因此將會邀請共同主持人及其他專業講者，進行工作坊式的授課。3.學生必須同時具備這兩種分析的思維方式，必要時進行切換，才能為自己的研究找到與學門溝通的語言。(三)幫助學生熟悉新聞事件資料庫的資料格式，使用它來進行「厚資料」的收集，也就是分析全球的政治事件，探索個行為者間的互動、並從中探索出未曾發現過的行為、價值和關係樣貌。1.新聞事件資料庫是分析國際動向熱門的方法。透過分析新聞事件資料庫，同學可以選擇有興趣的國家或是次國家行為者，全面性的分析其間的互動關係。2.相對於傳統的國際關係資料庫(例如Correlates of wars projects)，新聞事件資料庫提供了更豐富的紀錄：行為模式不僅限於實體的戰爭，更有口頭的威脅或是合作關係；行為者也不局限於國家，更包含了政府與非政府組織、甚至是個人。學生可以因此透過熟悉新聞事件資料庫進而分析各類有興趣之主題。3.Integrated Crisis Early Warning System (ICEWS，衝突綜合預警系統)為目前穩定更新的主流事件資料庫，除了有即時的更新至少半年前，更提供清理過和相對原始的檔案。這對於剛入資料科學之門的社科人將極具親和力，不僅也有助於開發新的關係測量方式。4.在使用已經初步整理之新聞事件資料庫(例如ICEWS、GDELT等)外，也將鼓勵學生透過本校已訂閱之LexisNexis檢索系統，除建立自身興趣或畢業論文相關之研究主題外，也可讓學生對於何謂「初步整理過的資料」和「原始資料」的差異性，對起點和終點的樣貌有更充分了解後，將有助於學生更快熟悉資料分析的基本流程和期待。(四)幫助學生具備自我學習、與國際接軌（如使用R-bloggers及透過期刊論文找到相對應的R套件）能力，尤其是接上本課群設計的三門探索式資料分析為核心內容的課程—《政治與資訊》、《社群媒體分析》及《民意與政治行為研究》—深化自己的技術能力。1.作為本課群的基礎課程，本課程以「培養興趣、打造自信、釋放想像」作為目標，以期能在這些心理素質的基礎上，讓同學進一步在進階（中高級）課程中磨練技術。2.透過以下做法，將培養同學自學的能力：（1）閱讀優秀的社科期刊論文並得知新的R套件、（2）在安裝及更新R套件時看懂說明書及更新時的說明文件、（3）訂閱Rbloggers強化自己對國際社群脈動的掌握。3.透過「期末專案共同指導」的概念，邀請課程團隊的其他主持人，共同聆聽學生專案的發表，提供建議，幫助學生在下一階段課程前修補不足之處。
評分方式: 1.課程參與：10%2.課堂作業：40%3.題目選擇報告：10%4.期末個人專案分析成果報告：30%5.課外演講：10%
授課方式: 本課程以面授與實做為主，授課方式可區分為三部分:（一）	上課前：要求每位學生必須完成:	閱讀指定教材之章節。	指定的預習或操作。	組成互助小組，共同解決課堂指派的議題或作業。（二）	上課中：	教師回答同學課前預習之疑問。	教師抽點同學上台報告讀書會實作成果。	教師並講解各單元之補充教材。（三）	下課後：	為下週指定進度進行預習。

課程大綱: 本課程將向參與者主題性地介紹西方政治思想與政治理論中的主要關懷和重要研究議題，如政治、國家、統治形式、主權與權力正當性……等。此外，亦將通論性地介紹與這些議題直接相關的重要思想家與學者，以及他們對於這些議題的思想與論述。

課程大綱: 本課程旨在從區域整合與互賴的觀點來探討全球化與半全球化時代五大區域合作發展軌跡。二次世界大戰以後無論是高度工業化國家或未開發國家，均因為貫徹國家利益之工具有嚇阻取向之武力投入如核武，使得傳統上由主權國家來主導之內政、外交、環保、經貿問題，無法單獨有效解決，故區域內國與國間以及各區域間因經濟、安全等互相依賴考量進而整合之趨勢乃因運而生。區域整合可粗略分為區域內社會文化整合，政策整合、政治體系整合、經濟整合及安全合作等。師生在本課程內，就此等層面進行分析與討論。

課程目標: 「轉型正義」是一門在歐美被視為正常政治議程與被嚴肅對待的研究學科，但在台灣卻被視浮不上嚴肅學術檯面、「清蒜豆蒸」(清算鬥爭)的政治修辭。更有甚者，「轉型正義」議題的相關學術書寫仍持續受到披著匿名審查外衣行言論審查之實的、違背學倫的審查人們所打壓與噤聲。本課程旨在帶領學生閱讀當代轉型正義思想家們的理論與討論轉型正義案例，促進學生們對台灣當前轉型正義政治議程的理解。在期中考前，學生們將從概念史、哲學，以及社會科學哲學等抽象層次來掌握轉型正義的研究主體、研究發展與研究目的。在期中考後，學生們將探討國際上的轉型正義案例，並藉此反思台灣本身的轉型正義工程與其所面臨的問題與挑戰。最終，本課程希望能讓學生們理解台灣當下轉型正義工程所遭遇的阻礙，並期望學生們能勇於陳述事實真理、挺身對抗不公不義，並為更良好的民主政治不懈地努力。
評分方式: 1.出席 + 討論：22%2.閱讀摘要之 一：20%3.閱讀摘要之二：20%4.期末報告：38%
授課方式: - 課程前半部分為口頭報告，報告結束後進行討論。參與者必需於課前完成指定範圍內的閱讀。每週也要求參與者對指定閱讀的其中之一進行口頭報告，並以書面方式提交閱讀摘要。摘要必須整理出當週閱讀之主旨與論點，並且提出自身的觀點、批判，或者討論問題。- 當週閱讀摘要：每次課堂前需先閱讀指定教材並撰寫摘要(不超過5頁)。摘要應包含以下內容：(1)整理作者主要觀點，並以自身話語重新表述；(2)提出自身觀點、批判，或討論問題；(3)與其他閱讀文本之間的比較。- 期末報告：學生們將以中文撰寫一份關於本課程的期末報告(去除參考文獻後，總頁數至少10頁，至多20頁)。該報告應包含以下重點: (1)研究題目、(2)研究問題、(3)解釋何以該研究問題重要、(4)對於該問題的既有研究文獻進行回顧、(5)對於該文獻的批判、(6)對於該研究問題的回答。- 抄襲零容忍，發現一律零分。- 期末報告繳交期限會於課堂上協調討論。- 本課程預定之每週授課內容將會依照實際修課人數而調整。

課程大綱: 本課程概述個體經濟學之主要理論，內容包括：information, game theory, public goods, externalities, uncertainty, time, asset markets, technology, consumers' behavior, 以及行為經濟學與實驗經濟學的介紹。

課程大綱: This is a course of basic econometrics. Econometrics is concerned with the systematic study of economic phenomena using observed data. We will mainly concern on the treatment of parametric modeling. (Therefore, there is a field called Nonparametric Econometrics—see Pagan and Ullah, 1999, Nonparametric Econometrics) To study the econometrics parametrically, we will first discuss regression analysis. The regression analysis put some variables (especially economic variables) to be some function (linear or nonlinear) of other economic variables and verse vise. These constitute the study of multiple regression and simultaneous equations model. On the other hand, time series analysis of econometrics, we regard the economics variable is coming from some stochastic mechanism of her own past and new innovation (unit variable time series analysis) and even stochastic function of other variables past value and innovation (vector time series analysis). These two views of econometrics is now somewhat merging. (See Granger, 2001, Macro Econometrics –Past and Future, Journal of Econometrics, 100). Extension of Basic Model Structure Change

課程大綱: 本課程目的在激發個人對創意思考與教學的知識學習、研究及應用等各方面的熱情。透過親身體驗創造力的技巧、理解創造力相關理論及其影響因素，能夠將創造力的知識、技巧應用於生活與教學，並且找出自己關心的創意思考與教學議題，發想並提出一個創意教學或研究計畫，掌握創造力應用及其研究之歷程。
課程目標: 1.	理解創造力的概念：4P、4C及4力。2.	理解創造力的重要理論及其應用。3.	理解並運用激發創造力的技巧。4.	理解並運用創造力的測量方式與工具。5.	理解、分析影響創造力的個人因素。6.	理解、分析影響創造力的外在因素。7.	具有研讀創造力相關研究報告之能力。8.	比較、分析與歸納不同的研究結果對於教學的啟示。9.	對於研究報告內容及研究方法的適切性具有批判能力。10.	從生活和經驗中尋找自己熱衷的創造力與教學議題，發想並提出可能的創意教學或研究計畫。

課程大綱: 教育是實現永續發展的基礎，從永續發展概述、永續發展教育的歷史演變和核心內涵加以理解，並探討永續發展教育與永續發展目標的關聯。從探討氣候變遷、循環經濟、消除貧窮以及企業永續等關鍵議題，進一步從經濟、社會與環境層面來翻轉我們的全球，為全球人類的永續發展向下扎根。
課程目標: 永續發展是當前全球最迫切的議題之一，永續發展的根本在教育。本課程旨在探討攸關永續發展的關鍵議題，提升對永續發展教育內涵與價值的理解，從經濟、社會與環境層面運用教育核心能力與素養，成為具備永續發展思維的全球公民。

中文名稱: 語言、文化及創造力研究
英文名稱: RESEARCH INTERSECTING LANGUAGE, CULTURE, AND CREATIVITY
課程大綱: Module I: What is Culture? This first module will introduce how culture has been defined and explored from various disciplinary perspectives, the ethical and epistemological implications of diverse approaches, and where these intersect with educational policy and practice. A major thrust of this section of the course will involve destabilizing the subject and decentering dominant narratives, individual and collective, regarding culture and identity. Module II: Culture and CreativityThis module will introduce dominant conceptualizations of creativity and ways of measuring creativity, exploring what research in various disciplines has shown about the relationships between culture and creativity. Module III: Language, Culture, and CreativityThis module will consider the nature of language, and its limits and capabilities, and explore the function of language in cultural propagation and creative transformation.
課程目標: This course will familiarize students with diverse conceptualizations and approaches to researching culture and creativity, while exploring the ways the nature and use of language interweave the two. Besides providing critical approaches to understanding respective concepts and their study through diverse disciplinary and professional perspectives, this course will entail an experiential component using collaborative explorations of the nature of play and ritual as a source of transformative potential for active negotiations of identity and environment.
評分方式: 1.Final Paper: Critical Incident：25%2.Group Project: Creative Play：25%3.Curiosity Cabinet：15%4.In-Class Reading Presentation：15%5.Active Participation：20%
授課方式: Throughout, students will engage in experiential tasks and reflective writing toward both individual and collaborative tasks focusing on identifying change, growth, and/or transformation related to language and culture, culminating in an individually written Critical Incident piece and a presentation of an ongoing collaborative group project exploring the nature of play and ritual.

課程大綱: How is learning changing in the knowledge age and digital world? What does the lifelong learner mean to address global issues and respond to real-world problems? This course offers weekly topics to explore educational issues, followed by tracing its foundations, paradigms, and applications of knowledge creation in education. Contemporary issues and methodologies will be addressed and included to broaden the perspectives of learning in the knowledge/digital age. This course also provides collaborative learning opportunities and group discussions to help you develop instructional design and research ideas based on your research interest.Please attend the Week 1 class overview if you are interested in taking this course.
課程目標: 1. Understand the foundations and paradigms of knowledge creation2. Apply theoretical groundwork to educational practices3. Integrate contemporary research results and their practical applications into teaching and learning4. Develop instructional and research designs for knowledge learning environments

課程大綱: This course explores the theoretical foundations and practical applications of dialogic edu-cation across disciplines. We will study key scholars who have significantly contributed to the understanding of dialogic processes in educational settings. Additionally, the course will cover research methodologies for investigating classroom dialogue, with a focus on both qualitative and quantitative approaches. The course will culminate in a final project where students design a strategy or intervention to promote effective classroom dialogue. This course invites you to critically engage with the concept of dialogue in education and to think creatively about how to apply these ideas in your own educational practice and even your own daily life. Your active participation and thoughtful contributions are essential to the success of the course.
課程目標: By the end of this course, students will be able to:1. Understand and articulate the theoretical foundations of dialogic education.2. Identify and analyze the contributions of key scholars in the field.3. Develop and apply research methodologies to study classroom dialogue.4. Design and propose strategies for promoting effective classroom dialogue in diverse educational settings.

課程大綱: 透過相關的閱讀與討論，本課程將教導學生一步步進行屬於自己的學術研究。從發掘疑問與研究議題、收集資料與相關的論文、閱讀與批判資料、到學習如何建立研究與理論架構，並大量收集證據來檢驗所建立之理論與主要論點。最後亦將練習如何將論點與證據清楚呈現於報告與論文的撰寫。
課程目標: （一）使學生了解學術研究的過程。 （二）教導學生收集研究資料之方法。 （三）訓練學生客觀評估現有學術研究的貢獻與缺點。 （四）引導學生建立自己的研究與理論架構。 （五）使學生練習將論點與證據清楚呈現於報告與論文的撰寫。

系所: 中國與亞太區域研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 本課程旨在讓同學了解法律的本質與功能，並在此基礎上學習正確思辨法律知識的方法和論文寫作的研究方法。教學方式包括教師講授、學生撰擬報告並口頭報告、評論他人報告。課程各階段安排如下：第一階段將透過閱讀文獻和書籍，由教師帶領討論，學生須閱讀指定教材並於課堂報告並參與討論。藉此使學生理解法律體系的本質和功能，並學習法學研究及解釋方法。第二階段將透過論文主題設定、大綱撰擬、文獻蒐集、瞭解學術論文撰擬格式及學術倫理要求，使學生具備法律研究者之基本能力。本課堂要求學生完成六小時之學術倫理教育課程訓練並於期末檢附相關證明文件。第三階段將由學生撰擬學術文章，並以模擬研討會方式安排口頭發表及同儕互評，藉此訓練學生學術發表及評論之能力。本課程鼓勵學生將研究成果發表於研討會或期刊。書面及口頭報告要求將於課堂上公告。※教師有調整授課進度與內容之權利，會事先告知學生※※本課程注重出席及討論，若因故無法前來上課，請於事前、當天或缺席一週內以電郵告知事由(病、公、喪、事假等)。逾期不予請假。事假過多者將酌扣出席成績(教師電郵：chyang@g-mail.nsysu.edu.tw)※※請勿以自己或他人之他課程作業、已發表或未發表文章，或任何非出於本學期己手完成之報告搪塞。違者將以不及格計※
課程目標: 本課程的設計目標是引導學習者了解法學的學科屬性，掌握法學專業研究的基本原理，使其熟悉系統性研究的專業知識，並藉此培養正確的研究態度，以期順利完成基於法學專業的學位論文。
授課方式: 教師講授、學生撰擬報告並口頭報告、評論他人報告

英文名稱: GOVERNMENTS AND POLITICS IN SOUTHEAST ASIA
系所: 中國與亞太區域研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 授課老師會在第一次上課的時候提供詳細的課程大綱，請同學以第一節課公布的課綱為主。
課程目標: 1. 以相關國際政治與比較政治理論的視角出發，學習描述、理解，並解釋當代東南亞各國之政治、經濟、與外交等領域。2. 熟稔並累積由政治學視角出發、關於東南亞之學術文獻，以及相關的研究。3. 培養結合學術研究，以分析國際時事現象之能力。4. 培養在多語境環境中，以中英文或其他外文，結合其他資源，對相關議題進行分析研究之能力。5. 培養並積累學術論文選題、寫作以及運用社會科學研究方法，對相關議題進行研究之能力。
評分方式: 1.課堂討論及參與：20%2.個別國家課堂報告：30%3.期末報告初稿：10%4.期末報告發表/presentation：20%5.期末報告本體：20%
授課方式: 1. 本課程以結合教師「講授」以及學生參與「討論」和「報告」並重的方式進行。每週的課程都會有一個至數個中心主題，搭配相關的閱讀材料。教師以講授方式介紹相關概念、同時帶出主題。同學則以閱讀材料為本，就相關題目進行思索以及討論。2. 本課程希望培養同學們的思辨、研究，以及用現代工具進行資料查找、搜尋的能力；本課程鼓勵使用適當的工具，如生成式AI（GAI）、電腦指令或模型或是其他資料爬梳工具進行資料搜集和研究。3. 本課程的工作語言以中文為主，但不限於中文，同學可用英文交報告，但請在事前和老師先討論。同時，為了培育下一代人類的思辨和語言能力，對Generative AI在語言上的使用會有規範。4. 修課同學在第二週必須選擇一個感興趣的、和本課程相關的題目（比如東南亞某個或某些感興趣的國家、東協本身，或是區域與某些特定國家的關係；經貿、投資、科技等等，在上課時提出討論。5. 本課程評量採綜合形式，也希望同學積極參與。從第三週開始，會請同學依照老師的給定框架，分組報告東協內部的國家，一方面讓同學熟悉以各種媒介和工具進行研究，另一方面藉由提高同學的參與程度，使同學更熟悉有興趣做進一步研究的國家。6. 最終評量是一篇1萬中文字以內的期末報告，或是研究計畫書。靈感可以來自先前的短篇回應文章。期末報告必須依循學術論文/研究格式，必須包含研究問題、文獻回顧、分析/理論架構、驗證方法（小樣本的案例研究或是數據分析），以及結論（報告主要發現，以及其政策價值等）7. 為訓練同學們的歸納和發表（presentation）能力，老師會要求同學以模擬學術會議的方式，在交報告之前，就自己的論文進行15分鐘內的發表。

英文名稱: THE APPLICATION OF INTERNATIONAL LAW ON CROSS-STRAITS RELATIONS
系所: 中國與亞太區域研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 本課程主要的重點在於介紹兩岸政治性、經貿性與事務性談判各項議題的內容，以及議題本身所涉及的國際法、國際政治與兩岸關係的關連性。本課程大致按照較重要的兩岸協商議題的種類加以區分，並依議題發生的順序先後，由民國八十一年四月兩岸兩會香港文書驗證談判、「一個中國」各自表述與在新加坡舉行第一次「辜汪會談」四項協議的簽署談起，並介紹其歷史與政治背景。由於兩岸關係發展與兩岸協商的主要癥結，在於國家主權歸屬與對於「一個中國」問題雙方認知的嚴重差異，因此在課程的開始，在開宗明義上首先討論兩岸的主權問題與其在國際法、國際政治上的意涵，接著依序討論雙方所提出的各項議題的相關重點，以及各議題所涉及的國際法、國際政治、兩岸關係與國內法的相關問題，最後以綜合性的分析來說明，兩岸兩會在協商談判的各自意圖與策略佈局上的可能假設。
課程目標: 本課程的教學目標在於經由兩岸國際法的案例，教導學生對於國際法的認識與應用，目的在於讓學生對於攸關國家未來的主權問題與兩岸政治癥結有專業性的理解，培養學生養成具國際觀的公民素養。
授課方式: 兩岸實際案例與理論結合；上課學生必須輪值報告案例、參與討論 以教師講授為主，並且要求學生在課堂上參與相關的討論。

課程大綱: 本課程將以近期出現之重要社會議題、國內外重大事件為標的，從法律層面予以探討分析。課程範圍除我國立法、憲法解釋及學說見解，亦將參照外國法及國際法上相關判決，以進行較完整豐富的分析討論。本學期擬探討之議題有：（一）國會職權行使法/國會調查權相關爭議，（二）人工生殖法修法相關爭議，以及（三）運動員性別認定爭議。（順序視同學報告主題選擇及課程進行狀況調整）同學亦得建議有興趣討論之議題，或自選期末報告主題。主題一：立法院職權行使法修法/國會調查權相關爭議研討釋字第325號解釋、釋字第585號解釋、113年度憲立字第1號聲請案、113年憲暫裁字第1號暫時處分裁定113年度憲立字第1號聲請案專家意見書胡博硯（2024），〈國會調查權怎麼調？〉，《當代法律》，第29期。李寧修（2024），〈國會調查權之建構：聚焦憲法權力分立原則所揭示之基本界限〉，《當代法律》，第29期。徐名駒、廖宏偉、廖義銘（2024），〈國會調查權與國會自律－以權力現象學之分析為基礎〉，《當代法律》，第29期。陳利益、張宏林（2024），〈只擴權不自律：當前國會改革的盲點〉，《當代法律》，第29期。李寧修（2018），〈論國會調查權之革新與展望〉，《政大法學評論》，第154期。「國會擴權法案之違憲審查—憲法法庭言詞辯論之後」座談會，2024年8月17日：姚孟昌，〈憲法法庭言詞辯論之補充陳述〉；廖國翔，〈國會擴權法案之違憲審查—憲法法庭言詞辯論之後〉。主題二：人工生殖法修法相關爭議研討衛生福利部國民健康署，〈人工生殖法修正草案總說明〉（人工生殖法修正草案條文對照表）。立法院社會福利及衛生環境委員會（2024），〈「人工生殖法條文修正草案」公聽會報告〉。衛生福利部（2023），〈審查台灣民眾黨黨團擬具人工生殖法部分條文修正草案〉，立法院第 10 屆第 8 會期 社會福利及衛生環境委員會、司法及法制委員會委員聯席會議。法國法相關規範及修法歷程、 loi du 2 août 2021 relative à la bioéthique鄧學仁（2024），〈人工生殖法修法之爭議〉，《當代法律》，第30期。林志潔（2024），〈人工生殖法修正草案下的代孕議題〉，《當代法律》，第30期。郭欽銘（2024），〈人工生殖法與家事法若干法律問題之研析〉，《當代法律》，第30期。戴瑀如（2024），〈多元家庭與人權保障下對於人工生殖法草案之評析〉，《當代法律》，第30期。官曉薇（2024），〈談人工生殖法修法爭議：擴大適用範圍及代孕合法化〉，《當代法律》，第30期。戴瑀如（2012），〈從人權保障的觀點審視人工生殖法制所面對的難題〉，《2011 科技發展與法律規範雙年刊》，健康、科學與人權－法學專書系列之十五，吳全峰主編，中央研究院法律所。主題三：運動員性別認定爭議歐洲人權法院判決Semenya v. 課程大綱: This course introduces basic and advanced regression models and their estimations. We will cover different types of data and introduce the estimation approach for each data type. The outline of this course contains the nature of some basic regression methods, the statistical characteristics of regression models, the exploration of data patterns, and the estimation methods for each regression model. The econometric models will be practices in several economic examples with quantitative data. Students are assumed to have taken an introductory course in statistics and to be comfortable with the application of at least one software package, for example, Eviews, R, and Stata. There are weekly assignments. Students are advised to spend at least three hours to reviewing the materials and completing assignments.
課程目標: This course is aimed to present the basic statistical techniques that are useful in quantitative analysis for business/policy decision making. I will introduce the theory of several econometric models and illustrate the application of each model. The econometric models include simple and multiple regression approaches in different data structures. I will provide sufficient examples from the textbook for the students to link between theoretical concepts and the numerical data applications. The students are expected to be familiar with the estimation approach for different regression models.
授課方式: Lectures, open discussion, oral presentations, assignments

課程大綱: This course aims to help students understand the aspects of the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), with a focus on the development of specific subfields such as international trade law, international law of the seas, and international environmental law. Relevant topics include the general exceptions under GATT and related cases, regulations concerning marine environmental pollution, and the international legal framework for climate change (including UNFCCC and the Paris Agreement). The teaching methods include lectures by professor, student-prepared reports and presentations, as well as making comments on others' reports.Students are required to read assigned literature before class, actively participate in class discussions, and answer questions. They must also prepare a final report and present it in English during the class.This course encourages students to present their research findings at conferences or publish them in journals. The requirements for written and oral reports will be announced in class.Professor reserves the right to adjust the course schedule and content, with prior notice to the students.Attendance and participation are emphasized in this course. If you are unable to attend a class, please notify the instructor via email before class, on the day of, or within one week of the absence, providing a valid reason (illness, official leave, bereavement, personal leave, etc.). Late requests for leave will not be accepted. Excessive personal leave may result in a deduction of attendance points. (Instructor's email: chyang@g-mail.nsysu.edu.tw).Please do not submit assignments from this or any other course, previously published or unpublished articles, or any work that was not completed personally during the current semester. Violators will receive a failing grade.
課程目標: This course aims to explore various aspects of sustainable development through the United Nations SDG sustainable development goals and specific international law sub-fields (such as international trade law, international law of the sea, international environmental law, etc.). And compare the similarities and differences between the legal systems for sustainable development in Taiwan and other countries.
授課方式: Lecture, students' written paper and oral presentations, and making comments on other people’s papers

課程大綱: 本課程為上下兩學期的學年課，限曾經修過WTO與兩岸關係，或國際法與兩岸關係任何一門課程的學生選修。一、兩岸司法管轄權爭議的案例分析。二、辜汪會談五項事務性議題的法律分析。三、兩岸主權問題與一個中國的國際法意涵。四、兩岸的法律戰－反分裂國家法的制定。五、國際戰爭法在兩岸的適用問題。六、國際經濟法有關的貿易正常化原則在兩岸的適用。七、國際經濟法有關的投資正常化原則在兩岸的適用。八、WTO原則與發展對兩岸經貿關係的影響。九、兩岸民事管轄的法律衝突與國際法律原則適用。十、兩岸刑事管轄與刑事司法互助議題。

課程大綱: 涂爾幹身處社會學剛建立的年代，為了捍衛社會學的正當性，強調社會是超越個人總和的獨特存在，且只有社會學能研究這種實體。他特別挑選可以個人完成的自殺，論證即使是這種最個人化的現象，也必須以社會因素解釋，其他事情就更不用說了。相較於古典社會學極力撇清個人因素，當代社會學更加強調社會結構與個人行動之間的互動。對政治學、經濟學產生影響的社會資本理論，就是這樣的思考。本課程透過精讀《自殺論》與《社會資本》，帶你瞭解社會學的精神以及社會學家如何做研究。
課程目標: 培養同學精讀文本（close reading）、批判性閱讀文本的能力，並能從中開發問題意識、形成自己的知識地圖。

課程大綱: 科技與社會研究（Science, Technology and Society 或稱 Science and Technology Studies，STS）的研究風潮大約在1970年代開始於歐美國家盛行，以具有開創性的理論與方法，關注科技與社會之間的相互形塑，過去十多年間，STS領域在台灣也日漸受到重視，並且逐漸發展出屬於東亞STS的特性。STS是一門跨界的學科，橫跨科學、醫療、性別、技術等，關注的議題也相當多元，涉及知識的生產、傳播與接收、使用與回應，不僅探究科技對於我們日常生活的影響，也關注科技的相關爭議、行動與公民參與。　　在我們身邊，有各種科技與社會交織的議題，測量環境風險與食品安全的指標是怎麼訂出來的？發展科技的時候，科學家想像的是誰的需求？科技的家電設計是讓誰更舒適＼辛苦？如何讓科技適合於此時此地的人？AI技術的發展與治理背後反映了什麼樣的權力政治？ Jasanoff and Kim (2009)提出「社會技術的想像」（sociotechnical imaginaries）一詞，強調科學知識的生產必定隱含對於社會是好的、或是什麼是可欲的社會世界想像，而我們必須思考的是，這些對於社會未來的美好想像是由誰決定的？本課程從社會學的角度出發，在探究「科技議題的民主參與如何可能」的大哉問下，帶領同學思考科技與社會如何相互共構、以及探討科學發展與科技決策中的專家知識、科學溝通、治理以及公民參與。本課程一共設計了三大主題：「科技渴望社會」、「科學民主化」、「科技決策、治理與公眾參與」。首先，我們將先學習以不同的觀點（如：科學知識社會學、技術的社會建構、行動者網絡理論、實驗室研究等）反省nature/culture, materiality、現代v.s 傳統等核心的爭論。第二，我們將討論專家知識的治理危機，從中探究專家與常民之間的互動與知識型態。第三，我們將一同思考在科技的治理與決策溝通中，「公眾在哪裡？」，並進一步思考面對新興科技的發展，我們如何想像並參與在科技的創新與治理過程。　　這堂課希望能帶領學生閱讀STS經典文獻，透過各種案例的討論與實作，一起腦力激盪，不再是科技與社會的二分思維，而是找到更為多元的視角來理解我們所處的科技社會
課程目標: 這是一門研究所的課程，藉此課程希望幫助學生對科技的民主治理有更多的認識、並能培養學生跨領域思考的能力以及科技民主的基本視野。
評分方式: 1.閱讀筆記與提問：20%2.課堂導讀：20%3.期末報告：40%4.課堂出席與參與：20%
授課方式: 上課將以老師講授、學生需參與文獻的導讀與討論的方式進行 因應疫情，第一週將採取遠距上課，使用的軟體為Google Meet，網址如下：https://meet.google.com/gos-rvuf-mkq因第一週將導讀週次的分配，請修課同學務必線上出席課程。

課程大綱: 檔案是社會關係的產物，檔案是社會關係的殘餘。多年後，我們又帶著社會學的問題意識，想藉由檔案，重新描繪久遠以前的社會關係。這堂課的開設對象，是給社會所（或鄰近系所）研究生。但也歡迎有志於畢業後能以「應用檔案」作為其中一項技能的大學部高年級學生參與（例如你想擔任法案助理、政策規劃、策展、書寫創作…）。
課程目標: 在這堂課程中，我們會介紹目前已經豐碩的日治時期檔案，及近年數量不斷上升的戰後檔案。首先，我們將介紹檔案學基本視野，並介紹目前較容易利用的十多個檔案資料庫，讓同學動手練習熟悉如何運用。次者，我們想閱讀一些社會學如何看待檔案，及進入現代世界後國家（或各種組織）生產大量檔案的社會學意義的文獻。最後，我們將閱讀一些本土研究，並邀請學者現身說明使用檔案過程中的「幕後甘苦談」。總體來說，我們希望能讓同學在有明確問題意識（這是同學自己的責任）的前提下，避免如「瞎子摸象」般的迷失在檔案堆，進而有規劃地運用檔案完成研究。因此，我們要求課堂同學在期末時完成一份關於「我的研究可以利用那些檔案」的清冊，並說明不同機關生產的檔案間的彼此關係（若是大學部同學修課，可以另外討論期末作業的內容）。注意！這不是一門輕鬆的課，我們會安排一些作業。次者，有沒有「動手找檔案」相當重要，如果無法配合進度動手做，會很難達成課程要求。最後，檔案只是眾多方法的一種，絕不是「我不想做田野，也不想做檔案」的替補選項──檔案有它的獨特貢獻，也有它的獨特侷限。你只有清楚認識到檔案的可能性，才能考量它是不是符合你的需求？要不要選擇這門課？避免你選完這堂課，卻對你的研究幫助有限。

課程大綱: This course guides students to reflect on spatial experiences in everyday life from a sociological perspective with a focus on gender consciousness. Through various domestic and international empirical case studies, we explore why men and women have distinct spatial experiences due to gender. Why do men naturally occupy most of the social space, while women often feel "out of place" in certain areas? Furthermore, we investigate how certain locations are perceived as masculine and rugged, while others are positioned as "feminized." Additionally, we introduce instances of gender discrimination and homophobia occurring at different geographical scales, intertwining with race and class, resulting in specific gender subjects facing inequality, deprivation of their living spaces and rights. Space not only serves as a medium for social oppression and control but also as a tool that marginalized gender groups employ to resist. Through activities like protests, they occupy physical spaces and redefine the cultural meaning of places, thus challenging existing social structures.The course is divided into three parts. Firstly, we introduce the concepts and methodologies related to gender and space. Secondly, we examine how social constructions of gender differences shape people's lived experiences in various geographical scales (homes, cities, nations) and aspects (public spaces, leisure areas, workplaces). We explore how these daily experiences reproduce our gendered bodies, identities, interactions, and social institutions. Finally, we apply human geographical analyses of gender to discuss gender-space issues in various social aspects such as mobility, the internet, sexuality, health and care. The course not only encourages students to reflect on their daily spatial experiences but also familiarises them with feminist and gender studies' important ideas and theories. Through case discussions related to weekly themes, students are guided to consider tangible actions to create more gender-friendly and inclusive spaces in pursuit of social justice.
課程目標: This course guides students in critically reflecting on everyday spatial experiences from a gender-conscious geographical perspective, using these reflections as a foundation to explore various academic issues related to space, power, gender, and desire.

課程大綱: Public diplomacy promotes a country's national interests by understanding, informing, and influencing foreign publics and broadening dialogue between a country's citizens and institutions and their counterparts abroad. This course is designed to provide students an in-depth understanding of public diplomacy as an instrument of foreign policy. It will explore the evolution of public diplomacy and the motivations and approaches of various stakeholders.In particular, this course will introduce selected countries' public diplomacy experiences and strategies, including South Korea. Why do we need to research "public diplomacy" as a new tool of foreign affairs? Who involves in it? What is the role of the state as well as civil society in public diplomacy?Thus far, public diplomacy has been regarded as an accessory to significant state relations and studied by foreign affairs specialists. As the Foreign Policy Center of Great Britain states that "perception and public opinion are increasingly important calculations for states acting on the world stage," governments can no longer afford to eschew the value of 'public diplomacy' as a strategic tool. Therefore, specialists with solid methodological skills and a deep understanding of public relations and public opinion need to study public diplomacy.The course is divided into three parts: First, we will begin by introducing public diplomacy in general and the changing trend in international aspects. Second, we will overview selected countries' public diplomacy and how governments and civil society responded to public diplomacy strategies. The last part of the class will conduct a comparative analysis among selected countries' public diplomatic strategies and purposes.By the end of the semester, students will have 1) thorough knowledge of the emerging issues in public diplomacy, 2) an understanding of the various new and traditional public diplomacy tools that can be used to promote national interests and values, and 3) a capacity to relate foreign policy issues and cultural values to public diplomacy.The syllabus is subject to change based on the number of students and the level of the student.
課程目標: 1.To understand public diplomacy in conceptual and historical term2.To know diverse public diplomatic strategies and the role of governments and civil society3.To be familiar with the advantages and disadvantages to pursue public diplomacy in historical lessons4.To conduct a comparative study

系所: 社會創新研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 隨著人文社會科學領域的文化轉向，｢創意｣儼然已成為21世紀城市再生與發展的新解。蘭德利(Charles Landry)提出的創意城市(Creative city)概念、以及佛羅里達(Richard Florida)的創意階級(Creative class)論述，共同描繪出對於21世紀城市的願景—Landrty認為，城市不僅提供居住、工作與生活的環境，同時也應是充滿生機活力，且能回應問題、提供解方的場所。因此，理想的城市應能孕育多元文化與創意經濟，並創造有意義的社會連結。Florida則強調創意人才的重要，他認為這群｢創意階級｣--包含工程師、藝術家、設計師、 媒體人等知識型工作者，具有高度創造力，能為城市的經濟活動與文化氛圍注入創新活力。本課程將以高雄城市為案例，帶領同學共同探索高雄，以此學習應用創意城市的分析方法。此外，課程將同時導入從社區觀點出發的文化純正性(authenticity)與社會基礎建設的概念，對創意城市的概念進行檢視與修正。修習本課程同學須於第二週選定高雄市區內一特定空間（如：圖書館、劇場空間、社區活動中心、共享空間 co-working space、街區、或任一具備創意空間潛力之場所作為本學期的分析對象；請考量自身交通條件進行選擇），依課程進度，分別對其空間、活動、歷史文化、社群/社區、以及制度進行觀察及研析，並於課堂上進行簡報與討論。期末同學則須針對該場所進行整體評估，並以促進創意城市發展為前提，提出一虛擬的行動構想方案。藉由高雄不同類型城市空間的觀察分析，學習創意城市的分析工具，並以亞洲經驗與歐美經驗出發的創意城市理論，進行對話。'Creativity' has emerged as a key solution for urban regeneration and development as the humanities and social sciences undergo a 'cultural turn.' The concept of the 'creative city' proposed by Charles Landry, along with Richard Florida's discourse on the 'creative class,' together paint a vision for cities in the 21st century. This course will use Kaohsiung as a case study to guide students in exploring the city and applying the analytical methods of the creative city concept. Additionally, the course will introduce the concepts of cultural authenticity and social infrastructure from a community perspective to critique and refine the creative city concept.By the second week, students are required to select a specific site within Kaohsiung (such as a library, theater, community center, co-working space, neighborhood, or any place with creative potential) for analysis throughout the semester. Following the course schedule, students will observe and analyze their chosen sites in terms of spatial characteristics, activities, history, culture, community, and systems, and present their findings in class discussions. For the final project, students will conduct a comprehensive evaluation of the site and propose an action plan aimed at promoting Creative City development. Through the approach of 'learning by doing,' students will practice the analytical tools and refine creative city theory based on their Kaohsiung experiences.
課程目標: 學習創意城市的理論工具與分析方法To learn the analytic tools and theory of creative city培養批判思考能力，以案例為基礎對既有理論進行檢視與修正To develop the ability of critical thinking on theories從實際案例操作中練習議題指認、並培養解決問題的能力To cultivate the ability to discover and solve problems

課程大綱: 真實的鄉村社會多元多變、並且正朝向不同方向持續演化。雖面臨各種風險與挑戰，但在其中往往隱藏許多機會與可能。然而，在發展為導向的思維下，城市被視為帶動區域發展與經濟繁榮的推進器，鄉村在於糧食生產、多樣性保持、文化保存、防災等面向的貢獻鮮少被提及，鄉村發展也被侷限於接收城市的外溢效應。都心主義的預設，使得多數資源投注於城市，鄉村倍受忽視，失衡的城鄉關係僅是加劇不平等與分配不均，而無助於區域整體的發展。本課程意圖打破都心主義的思維與發展模式，重新定位鄉村在整體區域的功能角色，在較平衡的城鄉關係中，發掘鄉村及區域發展的議題、挑戰與機會。課程將分為兩大部分: 學期的前半階段，同學們將透過鄉村規劃專業者和鄉村在地創業者的演講，以及臺灣鄉村的實地參訪(本學期參訪地點:高雄美濃)，深入了解臺灣現今鄉村及區域規劃的重要議題、挑戰與困境。課程的後半階段，同學們將透過文獻閱讀，探究鄉村與區域發展相關的發展脈絡、現階段重要課題、與發展出的策略行動，並練習將其與前階段所觀察到的臺灣鄉村經驗，進行比較與對話。
課程目標: 了解在現代化與工業化發展趨勢下的區域與鄉村發展的重要課題與挑戰熟悉區域發展中鄉村的定位、功能與角色，並從中發掘鄉村的發展潛力

中文名稱: 地方、草根創新與永續轉型
英文名稱: PLACE AND GRASSROOTS INNOVATIONS FOR SUSTAINABILITY TRANSITIONS
系所: 社會創新研究所碩士班
課程大綱: Sustainability transitions do not occur in a geographical vacuum. The uneven development of global capitalism over the past few centuries has given rise to multiple socio-ecological challenges across the world. In response, various community-based social innovations and place-based activisms have emerged in pursuit of a more socially fair and environmentally sustainable future. This course aims to provide an overview of the geographical exploration of sustainability transitions and grassroots innovations, with a special focus on the notion of place.The course is composed of following themes: 1)	The space of sustainability transitions, in which some useful frameworks and spatial explorations of grassroots innovations will be introduced; 2)	Placing sustainability, in which various challenges facing sustainable development of marginalized areas will be discussed, along with several place-based approaches to imagining and delivering on sustainability in these contexts. 3)	When transitions meet place, in which the importance of engaging place and communities in the journey toward sustainability transitions will be explored.
課程目標: •	Establish a solid knowledge of key approaches to studying community-based social innovations for sustainable development•	Understand the inter-relations between grassroots innovations, sustainability transitions and place. •	Develop academic capabilities, including reading and writing English essays.•	Build transferable skills, including critical thinking, oral presentation and teamwork skills.
授課方式: This EMI course combines lectures, student-led presentations, in-class discussion, and individual assignments. To help students better understand the theories and concepts introduced in the course, it will be supplemented with screening films or other activities, whenever appropriate.

英文名稱: SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT ISSUES IN THE CONTEXT OF GLOBALIZATION
系所: 社會創新研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 1992 年地球高峰會議後，「永續」這兩個字就逐漸成為大家熟悉的詞彙，但面對全球各式環境及社會經濟的問題與挑戰，該如何達成「永續」? 到甚麼程度的「永續」? 用什麼工具及方式邁向「永續」? 聯合國於2015年成⽴ 70週年之際，在世界各國領袖的簽署下，共同發佈了「翻轉我們的世界：2030年永續發展目標 (Sustainable Development Goals, SDGs)」，這17項目標同時兼顧經濟成⻑、社會進步與環境保護三⼤⾯向，顯⽰出任何⼈及任何產業都必須對這樣的永續發展有相當的認識與⾏動，無法置⾝事外。這門課程以「永續」為出發，藉由2030年永續發展目標 (Sustainable Development Goals, SDGs) 檢視與探討不同面向在地的議題，透過個案思考在地的挑戰與解方。
課程目標: 1) 瞭解與認識2030年永續發展目標 (Sustainable Development Goals, SDGs); 2) 思考台灣在地議題與永續關聯; 3) 透過不同面向的實際個案思考永續與社會創新的無限可能性。

Especially, in these courses you will learn the latest medical basic research and applications of cancer, including prevention, diagnosis, and treatment approaches.本課程主要旨在增強學生對癌症生物學和分子調控的理解。 本課程將從分子水平來描述癌症的產生、侵襲和轉移的機制。 從全面的臨床病理發現到基因突變、分子相互作用和信息路徑調控的深度。 主要內容含括DNA複製與修復、病毒腫瘤學、癌基因與抑癌基因、細胞凋亡、癌細胞轉移等機制。 特別是，在這些課程中，您將了解癌症的最新醫學基礎研究和應用，包括預防、診斷和治療方法。

課程大綱: 課程主要分為三大部分進行：一、醫療法規，二、臨床實務與法律，三、案例研析與小組討論。首先概括介紹醫療相關法規，使學生對醫療法規有初步認識，同時，亦進一步介紹臨床試驗與與其醫療行為相關的法律管制。協助醫療專業領域中的專業人士或本所研究生暸解與醫療行為相關之法律問題，並培養其未來從事相關問題之研究，或於其專業領域中解決相關法律問題所需具備的基本能力。課程的設計將涵蓋醫與護的專業需求，且將配合實際醫療機構的運作實務分別納入一般醫療給付與研究（或藥物基因體醫學）行為所牽涉之法律課題之探討。

英文名稱: THE ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE APPLICATION FOR SLEEP AND HEARING LOSS IN THE ELDERLY
系所: 醫學科技研究所碩士班
課程大綱: 人的一生中約有1/3的時間在睡眠，而台灣平均每100人就有4人有睡眠呼吸中止問題，老年人因肌肉張力減低，睡眠呼吸中止比例更高。國內外已有許多研究證實，睡眠呼吸中止症與憂鬱症、三高(高血壓、高血糖、高血脂)、冠心症有關，使治療此疾病帶有高度的公衛意涵，對於老年人健康更是有巨大之影響，透過AI技術輔助，有助於睡眠疾病之診斷與治療。台灣已邁入高齡社會，65歲以上的老年人口達300萬以上，老年性聽力障礙的問題更是值得關注。65歲，大約有1／3的人的聽力會越來越差，70歲以上，40%的人有聽力障礙；85歲以上的人，則有一半以上會出現聽力方面的問題。聽力不好，除了會影響認知功能、提高失智的風險之外，更與許多共病相關。
課程目標: 1.	瞭解聽覺、平衡生理功能。2.	瞭解老人聽損與健康問題。3.	瞭解暈眩平衡與健康之影響。4.	瞭解聽力、前庭復健方式。5.	目前助聽器之最新發展與功能。6.	認識AI智慧助聽器。7.	瞭解老年睡眠生理變化。8.	認識老年睡眠相關疾病。9.	老年睡眠疾病對身/心理之影響10.	認識老年睡眠疾病之治療。11.	認識目前AI人工智慧在睡眠疾病之應用與未來展望。12.	智慧睡眠機及舒眠機介紹。

課程大綱: This course combines statics and material mechanics, and aims to provide courses that want to condense the original two courses into one semester. Statics and material mechanics are introductory courses in the field of mechanics, and are required courses for many engineering departments. Under the concept of basic mechanics, a more systematic and in-depth discussion is added, emphasizing the concept of free body diagrams and introducing vector representation to solve the force balance problems of common structures in engineering. Moreover, stress and deformation in various components are discussed, including axial load, torsion and pure bending. Each analysis is based on some basic concepts, such as the balance condition of the forces acting on the component, the relationship between the internal stress and strain force of the material, and the conditions imposed by the support and load of the component.
課程目標: This course introduces a fundamental of load analysis, stress and strain concepts under static equilibrium. After this course, students are able to understand the strength of the material under static equilibrium, as well as the deformation and stress-strain distribution generated inside the structure when subjected to external forces.

This course enables students to understand the latest development and application of heterogeneous integration packaging, and equips students with the ability to face the ever-changing packaging industry.

課程大綱: 1.	系統級電路之電磁雜訊源分析 2.	靜電放電與電磁雜訊耦合基礎原理 3.	濾波、屏蔽與接地等EMI防制技術 4.	系統層級訊號完整性之分析分析 5.	系統電路電磁干擾量測與法規規範

中文名稱: 資產管理業務風險解析與管理實務
系所: 國際資產管理研究所碩士班
課程大綱: In recent years wealth management has become one of the fastest growing disciplines in the banking industry. It is certainly fueled by the fundamental intermediary role that banks play in the economy that expands globally with significant complexity. It is also driven by more riskseeking behavior of the industry in order to achieve more profits. Another important reason is the increasing sophistication of the quantitative capability, including both methodology and technology.There have been many modules and/or paperworks on quantitative risk management. Most of them focus on specialized subjects. Only few advanced wealth management modules are applicationoriented.This module offers a detailed introduction to the field of wealth management in terms of operation management and risk management as performed at large investment and commercial banks, with an emphasis on the practices of specialist market risk and credit risk departments as well as trading desks. A large portion of these practices is also applicable to smaller institutions that engage in trading or asset management.
課程目標: The aim of this module is to be comprehensive in looking at the activities of operation management and risk management specialists as well as trading desks, at the realm of mathematical finance as well as that of the statistical techniques, and, most important, at how these different approaches interact in an integrated risk management process.
授課方式: 2-hour lecture to outline and demonstrate each topic everyweek with 1-hour seminar to conduct and discuss the practical case.Group discussion, peer discussion, self practice

課程大綱: The course is designed to articulate the international regulatory and supervisory framework and how regulatory authorities conduct their supervisory work to maintain the safety, soundness and stability of the financial system. The course covers the fundamental concepts of supervision and regulation; the risk focused supervisory approach; and the supervisory tools that regulatory authorities can deploy to deal with problem banking institutions such as enforcement actions
課程目標: The course discusses the purpose of financial institution supervision and regulation which is to maintain a safe, sound, and stable financial system. We present the typology of risk types and the various exposures of companies to types of uncertainties for both financial and non-financial corporations. We discuss how asset/ liability management can help to address liquidity risk in periods of market turmoil for both financial and non-financial firms. We illustrate how liquidity risk has been the trigger for bank runs and the failure of major financial institutions. We discuss how to mitigate operational risk, which can be a major source of financial losses, with emphasis on new operational risk emerging from the digital economy such as cyber risk and reputation risk. We also address model risk that has recently come under close scrutiny by the regulators, in particular model risk related to the use of machine learning and artificial intelligence. We review what are best practices in corporate governance, which plays a central role in risk management. Credit risk is the largest and most elementary risk faced by banks, and it is a major risk for many other financial institutions and levered corporations as well. We examine both credit risk in retail banking and commercial banking. We discuss scoring practices for retail loans and the rating of corporate loans. Then, we review credit risk modelling in a portfolio context. Finally, we give an extensive review of how Fintech is impacting all the core functions of financial intermediation and the traditional business model of banks.
課程目標: The objective of this course is to give an overview of best practice risk management in investment banking in light of the major shocks, financial and technological innovations that have shaped the financial system since the beginning of the century. The “dot.com” crisis in year 2,000, followed by a series of fraudulent failures such as Enron and WorldCom and later in 2007-2009 the GFC (Great Financial Crisis) led to several major overhauls of bank regulation and corporate governance. Fintech companies are challenging the traditional business model of banks by offering financial services in cheaper and friendlier ways than traditional banks.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】從搖籃到墳墓，公共事務的複雜性、多樣性、以及可能引發的爭議，越來越超乎過去的想像，在管理上也面臨前所未有的挑戰。前瞻基礎建設計畫真的可以平衡區域經濟發展?還是債留子孫，導致另一波財政危機?相愛結婚不是人權嗎?為什麼同志結婚的立法過程步步艱辛?公私協力是提升政府效能的新治理模式還是官商勾結的溫床?政府到底是管太多，還是根本沒在管?在這個缺乏共識、假消息滿天飛的現代民主社會，要怎麼精準掌握資訊及社會氛圍，形成共識、讓公共利益極大化，在政府財政日漸困窘的情況下，滿足最大多數人的需求?本課程在於提升及強化學生在公共事務領域的專業知能，除了嫻熟相關理論及法規，更協助學生理解政治、經濟、社會、文化、時空脈絡等因素如何影響公共管理及政策制定，從而正確並有效率的運用科技工具，以全面而多元的視角針對問題進行深入分析，充分掌握資訊以做出精準而適當的決策，成為一流的公共管理人才。本課程除了介紹現代公共管理的核心價值與理論趨勢，更著重於學術研究與實務應用的連結，兼顧理論變遷與個案實例，課程內容涵蓋城市衰退與更新、鉅型計畫與財政危機、地方治理、政策網絡、社群媒體、決策與危機管理等等，引領學生從複雜多變的公共議題中思辨公共事務的本質、運作、構成、產出以及影響，同時培養跨界對話於持續創新的能力。另外，學期中也會邀請校外專業人士進行專題演講，並安排學生實地參訪政策相關機構或場域，實際了解公共管理及政策的動態過程。This course is designed to help individuals who are developing abilities and skills as leaders in public management and policy making, within government or communities, with an NGO or within the private sector. The course aims to promote and strengthen the interrelationship between academic research and practical application in public affair management. Integral to these aims, this course will promote better understanding regarding the time-space context of policy change and emerging technologies, which profoundly influence management thinking and strategic planning. This course provides a broad overview of public management and covers critical issues such as urban decline, financial crisis, civil society, sustainability and uncertainty. It includes a thorough exploration of strategic planning and marketing, policy networks and stakeholder identification, strategic misrepresentation (deception) and optimism bias (delusion), as well as affective atmospheres. Throughout the course there is an emphasis on the real-world policy making in the field of urban planning and regeneration, infrastructure and megaproject, local governance and community participation, whether that is in government at local and national levels, or in the third sector. This practice focus is reflected in the programmed fieldwork activities relevant to government and policy, the critique and analysis of case studies, and the assignments that students undertake which establishes the research base for their final presentation in this course. It aims to explore various dynamics in the urban system, discusses various design and operational scenarios and their impacts on the urban society, and later examines some aspects of megaprojects worth focusing and investigating.
課程目標: 1.	理解不同形式、層次、屬性、以及構成的公共事務2.	整合不同形式、層次的思考模式，以全面而跨領域的觀點思考公共議題3.	有效評估並掌握公共事務治理的複雜性、多樣性、及不確定性1.	Cope with different forms, levels, attributes and configuration of public affairs2.	Consider issues of public affairs from a range of disciplinary perspective, and Integrate different forms of thinking3.	Evaluate and grasp the implications of complexity, risk and uncertainty in policy-making
評分方式: 1.期中報告：30%2.課堂討論：20%3.期末報告：50%
授課方式: (1)	相關資料置於本校網路大學，請至本校圖資處首頁網路大學登入。(2)	輸入選課系統帳密登入課程下戴教學簡報及參考資料檔案。 (3)	非選課學生擬旁聽者，請於前述連結登入，並於留言區留下學號姓名，以做為其他處理之參考。每周課程主要分成兩個部分：(1) 文本導讀及討論。(2) 相關案例評析。每週課程的第一部份為概念講解與討論，同學在上課前必須閱讀該週指定文本，於課中發表自己的觀點並提出問題共同討論，經由意見交流、相互激盪，將相關知識內化。課程的第二部份為相關案例評析，主要目的是根據該週的主題，選擇實際案例進行討論，除了以習得的理論框架進行分析，更鼓勵學生以自身領域及經驗深入探討，提升相關知識與研究能力。另外，本學期會安排一到兩次的實地參訪，讓學生進入與課程相關的特定場址(field site)進行田野調查，並於參訪完後兩周繳交分析報告(期中考成績)，期末須選擇公共議題進行個案分析研究，並於最後一堂課簡報(需繳交書面報告)及討論。This course is divided into two parts. The first part studies the theoretical framework of public affairs and critical issues regarding management, governance and policy. In this part, we examine the global trends and developments of governance to acquire deeper insights into the interrelationships between government, private sectors and other stakeholders. The second part of the course starts with a discussion on real-world policy making by means of case studies analysis. We strongly encourage students to express their opinions on the issues from different perspectives and critically appraise different types of information. Then it proceeds on to discuss the dynamic process of project management and policy-making in the field of urban regeneration. Through our fieldwork encounters in the field site, crucially, students learn how to identify the major factors that influence the risks, innovation, benefits, and problems within the regeneration process.

Students will be introduced to public management concepts and receive the competencies required to address the challenges in the public sector. Students will explore innovative related to the management of public sector organizations, such as: Artificial Intelligence (AI) issues in public affairs management; Network and collaborative governance; social enterprise; service coproduction; smart cities and the application of big data analysis. For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】As cross-industry and cross-border platforms have become business trends, the relationship between competition and collaboration becomes more complex. The Competitive Dynamics Theory provides practical and appropriate methods to assist companies effectively face and solve business problems that have long been challenges in a shifting environment. The Theory is considered as one of the three theories in strategic management in the past three decades. The Harvard Business Review called it “the competitive advantage after Porter’s”. The Competitive Dynamics Theory believes competitive advantage is temporary, which is in contrast to the theory that used to emphasize sustained advantages. Furthermore, the Competitive Dynamics Theory integrated Chinese culture and philosophy with Western social science and systematic knowledge. Therefore, it can especially be applied to Chinese enterprises for practical practices. Entrepreneurs and managers with dynamic thinking and behavioral methods can help enterprises to build a strong foundation of business sustainability.This course is designed using “strategy 1-2-3” as the core structure. Lectures including dynamic strategy and structure, competitive dynamics analysis, competition and collaboration management, business ecosystem and changes, business development and transformation, culture, strategy, and execution, and East and West ambiculture.跨業與跨界平台已成企業經營趨勢，競爭與合作的關係變得日益複雜，因此，以往偏向靜態的策略理論與分析廣被質疑；如何運用新的策略觀點，務實且貼切地協助企業有效面對並解決動盪環境下的經營議題，成為學界與實務界共同的課題。動態競爭理論(Competitive Dynamics Theory)正好填補了這個需要。它是過去三十年來從策略管理領域本身發展出來的三個前沿理論之一，被哈佛商業評論稱為「後波特時代的競爭優勢」。它強調競爭優勢是暫時性的(temporary)，與過去強調持續性(sustained)優勢的理論正好形成強烈對比。另一方面，動態競爭理論整合了中華文化與哲學及西方社會科學與系統化知識，因此，特別適合華人企業從事實務應用；擁有動態思維體系與行為模式的企業家與專業經理人，將能幫助企業奠定永續發展的根基。本課程的設計以「策略1-2-3」為主軸，涵蓋的內容包括：動態策略思維與架構；動態競爭觀念的解析；競爭與合作的管理；商業生態系統與演變；企業成長與轉型；文化/策略/執行三環鏈；中西文化與管理的雙融等。課程除了提供中西不同產業的案例外，也搭配理論文章的研讀及應用工具的練習，期望同學不僅具備綜合性的動態思維，並將所學實際落實在職能培養與職業生涯的各個層面。
課程目標: The concept and goal of this course follow the academic research of Ming-Jer Chen, the establisher of the Competitive Dynamics Theory and Ambiculture Theory, and the former president of the Academy of Management (2012-2013). The course aims to train managers, entrepreneurs, and professionals with dynamic abilities. Students will have the chance to analyze, plan, and execute corporates’ competitive dynamics strategies to understand factors that influence business operations.本課程的理念與目標師法全球策略管理權威、動態競爭(competitive dynamics)暨文化雙融(ambiculture)理論創始人、國際管理學會(Academy of Management)前主席(2012-13)與終身院士陳明哲博士，主要目的在培養具有動態競爭與策略思維及紮實行動能力的經理人、企業家或專業人士。透過本課程的學習，同學將學會分析、制定和執行公司的動態競爭(和/合)策略，理解影響企業經營與發展的人、組織與環境因素。
評分方式: 1.Attendance 出席：25%2.Participation 課堂參與及討論：35%3.Final Presentation 期末報告：40%
授課方式: Lecture, case study, in-class discussion, group work, and guest speaker.主要採用蘇格拉底/孔子式的問答/對話方式，透過個案教學法及實際問題的提問與引導，理解問題的本質，同時也兼採小組活動與實作練習及專題演講等，以豐富課程內容。

It examines the critical role that IT plays in achieving organizational objectives, enhancing efficiency, and maintaining competitiveness. The course covers a wide range of topics, including IT governance, ethical considerations, business intelligence, cloud computing, IT project management, cybersecurity, innovation, and emerging technologies.Students will learn to formulate IT strategies that align with an organization's mission and goals, manage IT projects effectively, and leverage emerging technologies for strategic advantage. By the end of the course, students will be equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to develop, implement, and manage IT strategies that align with organizational goals, enhance competitiveness, and drive innovation. Through a combination of theoretical concepts, practical applications, case studies, and discussions, students will gain the expertise needed to make informed decisions regarding IT investments, governance, and cybersecurity within a strategic framework.

For those who do not provide information of course syllabus in English, do not check this field.)】As cross-industry and cross-border platforms have become business trends, the relationship between competition and collaboration becomes more complex. The Competitive Dynamics Theory provides practical and appropriate methods to assist companies effectively face and solve business problems that have long been challenges in a shifting environment. The Theory is considered as one of the three theories in strategic management in the past three decades. The Harvard Business Review called it “the competitive advantage after Porter’s”. The Competitive Dynamics Theory believes competitive advantage is temporary, which is in contrast to the theory that used to emphasize sustained advantages. Furthermore, the Competitive Dynamics Theory integrated Chinese culture and philosophy with Western social science and systematic knowledge. Therefore, it can especially be applied to Chinese enterprises for practical practices. Entrepreneurs and managers with dynamic thinking and behavioral methods can help enterprises to build a strong foundation of business sustainability.This course is designed using “strategy 1-2-3” as the core structure. Lectures including dynamic strategy and structure, competitive dynamics analysis, competition and collaboration management, business ecosystem and changes, business development and transformation, culture, strategy, and execution, and East and West ambiculture.跨業與跨界平台已成企業經營趨勢，競爭與合作的關係變得日益複雜，因此，以往偏向靜態的策略理論與分析廣被質疑；如何運用新的策略觀點，務實且貼切地協助企業有效面對並解決動盪環境下的經營議題，成為學界與實務界共同的課題。動態競爭理論(Competitive Dynamics Theory)正好填補了這個需要。它是過去三十年來從策略管理領域本身發展出來的三個前沿理論之一，被哈佛商業評論稱為「後波特時代的競爭優勢」。它強調競爭優勢是暫時性的(temporary)，與過去強調持續性(sustained)優勢的理論正好形成強烈對比。另一方面，動態競爭理論整合了中華文化與哲學及西方社會科學與系統化知識，因此，特別適合華人企業從事實務應用；擁有動態思維體系與行為模式的企業家與專業經理人，將能幫助企業奠定永續發展的根基。本課程的設計以「策略1-2-3」為主軸，涵蓋的內容包括：動態策略思維與架構；動態競爭觀念的解析；競爭與合作的管理；商業生態系統與演變；企業成長與轉型；文化/策略/執行三環鏈；中西文化與管理的雙融等。課程除了提供中西不同產業的案例外，也搭配理論文章的研讀及應用工具的練習，期望同學不僅具備綜合性的動態思維，並將所學實際落實在職能培養與職業生涯的各個層面。
